trodorne: Keep government funds out of abortion. I am technically a pro-lifer, but I'd rather women right to choose abortion and here is why. Consequences when legal would now be, have the kid, give the child up for adoption (cause there are ALOT of people whom are willing to adopt) or abort the life. cubbonkelly: Yes! I am from the isle of man and until last year, abortion was illegal! Now we have a progressive bill but unfortunately our government still haven't got the care in place and they are still shipping women to England to access abortion. But now at least they are paying for it. People do not realise that making abortion illegal does not stop it. Manx women would either go into debt getting a plane/boat over to england and then paying for the abortion or take matter into their own hands and buying pills online. It is a horrific way to treat women. It also bugs me that even though women were accessing abortion before, the anti-choice people came over from England to campaign against abortion and have set up their own small group here, paying for signs and their body cams. They didn't care before. We also had an American come over and threaten to sue our government if we made abortion legal. As you can imagine, us Manxies don't do well with people telling us what to do 😂. Keep on the fight and de-stigmatise abortion!

samrockhill: Thank you for supporting our right to choose!!
jessicaamy145: I think a lot of pro-lifers don’t think of the bigger picture. Okay, so you care about that child’s life? What about that child ending up in a care system and feeling unwanted? What about the child ending up living in poverty? What if that unborn child has extremely serious defects which would mean it would live a “life” in endless pain, a vegetative state? I would never, ever, be selfish enough to allow mu child to live in constant pain with no quality of life - that is cruel. It is kinder to stop those things from happening. I have personal experience and professional experience of adults in vegetative states and it is unbelievably cruel to allow it to happen. It isn’t a life, it’s an existence. Ultimately it is the woman’s choice, but I do feel a discussion between her and the father should take place (if the situation allows as obviously there are circumstances where it can’t). Religion shouldn’t be brought into such a serious subject either. Women don’t get abortions on a whim, women think long and hard. Allow a woman to do this safely. A woman who has gone through trauma (rape) and becomes pregnant is extremely mentally volatile and could do dangerous things to herself, unborn child and the baby when it arrives. Do pro-lifers all adopt the kids given up for adoption? No. They just want to remove a safe choice for a woman. I am pro-choice. I don’t judge other women for their actions, I don’t know their stories. Don’t be judgemental, allow them to make this decision in peace. ✌🏼
